intro: Elephantopus carolinianus var. simplex, commonly known as Carolina horseweed, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is an annual herb that typically grows in open fields, roadsides, and disturbed areas. The plant has hairy, branching stems and small, pale green leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are yellow and occur in clusters, and it produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. It is often considered a weed but has some historical uses in traditional medicine.
